feed.title: Google Cloud: Gemini Enterprise
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Gemini Enterprise

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Unified data source creation and action flow

The new unified process for creating a data store enables you to create the data store and the associated actions in a single, streamlined flow. This functionality allows Gemini Enterprise to perform tasks directly within the connected application.

The new Actions page shows you all the enabled actions for each data store. Actions are available in public preview and are enabled for Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft OneDrive, Jira Cloud, Dropbox, and ServiceNow.

This launch includes support for the following data stores. Check the data store documentation pages for a list of supported actions.

Generally Available

  • Microsoft SharePoint
  • Microsoft Outlook
  • Microsoft OneDrive
  • Google Drive
  • Google Calendar
  • Gmail

Public Preview

  • Jira Cloud
  • Confluence Cloud
  • Box
  • Microsoft Teams
  • Dropbox
  • ServiceNow

Note: To use the unified view, your Google Cloud project must be on the allowlist.
entry.summary: Gemini Enterprise now offers a unified flow for creating data stores and associated actions, allowing direct task performance within connected applications. The new Actions page displays enabled actions for supported data stores like Microsoft SharePoint, Outlook, OneDrive, Jira Cloud, Dropbox, and ServiceNow, with many features now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Unified Data Creation and Actions for Gemini Enterprise

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Monitor metrics for NotebookLM Enterprise

Admins can monitor NotebookLM Enterprise metrics in the Agents tab of the Analytics page. For more information, see Metrics definitions.
entry.summary: Admins can now monitor key metrics for NotebookLM Enterprise directly within the Agents tab of the Analytics page. This provides valuable insights into usage and performance. For a detailed understanding of these metrics, refer to the Metrics definitions documentation.
entry.title: Feature: Monitor NotebookLM Enterprise Metrics

entry.content:
Google NotebookLM Enterprise: Gemini model upgrade (Preview)

You can use Gemini 2.5 Flash with NotebookLM Enterprise.
entry.summary: NotebookLM Enterprise now offers a preview of the Gemini 2.5 Flash model. This upgrade enhances the capabilities of NotebookLM Enterprise, providing users with advanced AI features for their projects.
entry.title: Feature: NotebookLM Enterprise Upgrades to Gemini 2.5 Flash

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Share custom agents registered with Gemini Enterprise (Preview)

Admins can share custom agents registered with Gemini Enterprise, including Agent-to-Agent (A2A), Agent Development Kit (ADK), Dialogflow agents, and agents added from Google Cloud Marketplace. For more information, see Share custom agents.
entry.summary: Admins can now share custom Gemini Enterprise agents, including A2A, ADK, Dialogflow, and Marketplace agents.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Agents Sharing

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Add agents from Google Cloud Marketplace (Preview)

Admins can add agents from Google Cloud Marketplace that use the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol. After an agent is purchased and added to Gemini Enterprise, end users can access the agent through the Gemini Enterprise web app. For more information, see Add and manage agents from Google Cloud Marketplace.
entry.summary: Admins can now add agents from Google Cloud Marketplace to Gemini Enterprise. End users can access these agents through the Gemini Enterprise web app after purchase.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: New agents available from Google Cloud Marketplace

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Use Nano Banana Pro for image generation (Preview)

You can use Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image) in Preview with Gemini Enterprise for image generation. To make this available to users in your Gemini Enterprise app, a Gemini Enterprise admin must select Gemini 3 Pro Image (Preview) in the Enable image generation feature control. For more information about feature controls, see Manage features on the web app.
entry.summary: Gemini Enterprise now supports image generation using Nano Banana Pro in Preview. Admins can enable this feature through the Gemini Enterprise admin settings.
entry.title: Feature: Nano Banana Pro for Image Generation

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Manage agents (Preview)

Using the Agents page, admins can see all agents that are available to users in the Gemini Enterprise web app. For more information, see Agents overview.
entry.summary: Admins can now view and manage all available agents for users in the Gemini Enterprise web app through the Agents page.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise Agents

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Save information as memories

You can ask the assistant to save and remember specific pieces of information for reference in future conversations. For more information, see Save information as memories.
entry.summary: Gemini Enterprise allows you to save information as memories for future reference.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: Save information as memories

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Enhanced Agent Designer with visual flow builder (Preview)

Agent Designer in Gemini Enterprise is enhanced with a new visual flow builder, offering a more intuitive and powerful way to create and manage complex, multi-step agents.

For more information, see Agent Designer overview.

To enable this feature for your users, a Gemini Enterprise administrator must enable the corresponding toggle in your app's feature management settings. For information about feature controls, see Manage web app features.

Note: The visual flow builder is available for all new agents created after this release. Existing agents will continue to use the familiar editor to ensure backward compatibility.
entry.summary: A new visual flow builder enhances Agent Designer in Gemini Enterprise, allowing for more intuitive creation and management of complex agents. This feature is available for new agents.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: Visual Flow Builder for Agents

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Use Gemini 3 (Preview)

You can use Gemini 3 in preview with Gemini Enterprise. To make Gemini 3 available to users in your Gemini Enterprise app, a Gemini Enterprise admin must enable the Gemini 3 Pro (Preview) toggle in the Model availability feature control. For more information on feature controls, see Manage features on the web app.
entry.summary: Gemini Enterprise now offers access to Gemini 3 in preview. Admins can enable this feature through the Model availability settings.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini 3 Now Available for Gemini Enterprise

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Sources from model

In the Sources panel of an answer, Gemini Enterprise shows other sources used by the Gemini models.
entry.summary: See the sources used by Gemini models in the Sources panel.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: Model Sources

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Microsoft OneDrive @mentions

You can use the @ symbol within your chats to mention and reference files in the connected Microsoft OneDrive data sources.
entry.summary: Mention files from OneDrive directly in your chats.
entry.title: Feature: OneDrive @mentions

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: View generated images and videos

You can view chats and download your generated images and videos using the Library. For more information, see View and download generated images and videos.
entry.summary: You can now view and download images and videos generated by Gemini Enterprise directly within the Library feature. Accessing your creations is easier than ever, allowing for seamless review and use of your generated content.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: View generated images and videos

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Register ADK and A2A agents

You can register your ADK agents that are hosted on the Vertex AI Agent Engine and your agents that were built using the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol with Gemini Enterprise. This makes the agents available to your users on the Gemini Enterprise web app.

For more information, see:

  • Register and manage ADK agents hosted on the Vertex AI Agent Engine
  • Register and manage A2A agents
entry.summary: Gemini Enterprise now supports registering ADK and A2A agents, making them accessible to users via the Gemini Enterprise web app.
entry.title: Feature: ADK and A2A Agent Registration

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Authorize assistant actions from the chat box

If actions are enabled for a data source, the user sees an Enable Actions button next to the data source listing in the assistant chat box. The user must click this button and complete authorization before they can use the assistant actions associated with the data source.
entry.summary: Users must now authorize data sources before using assistant actions within Gemini Enterprise.
entry.title: Changed: Gemini Enterprise: Action Authorization

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Layout parser support for DOCX, PPTX, and XLSX (GA)

With the layout parser, support for parsing DOCX, PPTX, and XLSX file formats is Generally Available (GA). Both the layout and digital parsers can parse PDF, HTML, DOCX, PPTX, and XLSX files. For more information about the parsers, see Parse and chunk documents.
entry.summary: Gemini Enterprise's layout parser now fully supports DOCX, PPTX, and XLSX file formats, in addition to PDF and HTML. This enhancement allows for more comprehensive document analysis.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: Layout parser now supports DOCX, PPTX, and XLSX files

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Hidden model thinking details

When generating an answer, the details of a model's thinking are always hidden to protect sensitive information.
entry.summary: The thinking process of the model is kept private to safeguard confidential data.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Enterprise: Hidden Model Thinking Details

entry.content:
Gemini Enterprise: Select individual connector instance

Select or deselect specific connector instances, such as Jira or Confluence, using the database icon located in the chat box.
entry.summary: Users can now select or deselect specific connector instances like Jira or Confluence directly from the chat box using the database icon.
entry.title: Changed: Gemini Enterprise: Connector Selection

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Configure prompt chips

You can create, delete, edit, and enable or disable Google-provided and custom prompts that provide better guidance to your users.

For more information, see Configure prompt chips.
entry.summary: New feature allows configuring prompt chips for better user guidance.
entry.title: Feature: Prompt Chips Configuration

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Generate images using Nano Banana (GA)

Image generation and editing with Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image) is generally available (GA) in Google Agentspace across Global, EU, and US multi-regions.

For more information on generating images, see Generate an image.
entry.summary: Image generation and editing with Nano Banana is now generally available in Google Agentspace. You can use this feature across Global, EU, and US multi-regions.
entry.title: Feature: Nano Banana Image Generation Now Available

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Manage image and video generation on the web app

By default, image and video generation are enabled in the Agentspace web app. To turn off these features, admins must navigate to the Configurations > Feature Management tab, and turn off the Enable video generation and Enable image generation options.
entry.summary: Admins can now manage image and video generation features directly within the Agentspace web app via the Configurations > Feature Management tab. By default, these features are enabled.
entry.title: Feature: Image and Video Generation Now Available in Agentspace

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Knowledge base filter for catalog entities in ServiceNow connectors (GA)

In your ServiceNow connectors, you can filter your knowledge base entities by catalog IDs. This lets you selectively ingest only those catalog entities whose catalogSysId matches the filter. If no values are specified, then the connector ingests all catalog entities. This feature is Generally available (GA).

For information about ServiceNow connectors, see Connect ServiceNow.
entry.summary: Filter your ServiceNow knowledge base entities by catalog ID to selectively ingest data. If no catalog IDs are specified, all entities will be ingested. This feature is now Generally Available.
entry.title: Feature: ServiceNow Knowledge Base Filter

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Interface updates

  • File uploads can be canceled at any time.
  • The Star and Share buttons now appear after a user has initiated a session by submitting a prompt.
entry.summary: Users can now cancel file uploads at any time. Star and Share buttons are visible after submitting a prompt.
entry.title: Changed: File uploads can be canceled

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Change in ACLs for incidents in ServiceNow

The access-control list (ACL) behavior for ServiceNow incidents has significantly changed, from too permissive to least-privilege behavior. This change drastically reduces the possibility of data leaks, but might be too restrictive for your needs.

For more information about ServiceNow, see Connect ServiceNow and Add ServiceNow actions.
entry.summary: A new, more restrictive ACL policy is now in effect for ServiceNow incidents, enhancing data security by adopting a least-privilege approach. This change aims to minimize data leak risks but may require adjustments to your existing configurations.
entry.title: Breaking: ServiceNow Incidents: New ACL Policy

entry.content:
Google Agentspace and Google NotebookLM Enterprise: Model Armor

Model Armor helps proactively screen prompts and responses within Agentspace apps and NotebookLM Enterprise instances. For more information on how administrators can enable this feature, see:

  • Enable Model Armor in Google Agentspace
  • Enable Model Armor in NotebookLM Enterprise
entry.summary: Introducing Model Armor, a new feature to help proactively screen prompts and responses.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Real-time sync (Public preview)

Real-time sync uses webhooks to receive notifications when data is created, updated, and deleted in a third-party data source. Notifications typically arrive within minutes of the event. The following data stores support real-time sync:

  • Jira Cloud
  • Confluence Cloud
  • Microsoft OneDrive
  • Microsoft SharePoint Online
  • ServiceNow

Support for real-time sync for these data stores is in Public preview.
entry.summary: New feature for Agentspace allows real-time data synchronization with popular tools like Jira, Confluence, OneDrive, SharePoint, and ServiceNow. Receive instant notifications for data changes.
entry.title: Feature: Real-time sync for Agentspace

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Interface updates

  • The LLM model selector has moved from the search bar to directly below the product logo in the top-left corner.
  • The web grounding tool and source has been renamed Google Search and Enterprise web search, depending on the type of web grounding configured.
  • The Sources button in the search bar has been renamed Data.
  • The Data menu (formerly Sources) now shows which sources are selected.
entry.summary: The LLM model selector is now below the product logo. Web grounding tools and sources have been renamed. The Sources button is now called Data and the Data menu shows selected sources.
entry.title: Changed: Interface Updates
